p: For Opt.W-M treatment, planting date and crop management were adopted according to soil-crop system management 51. Winter wheat was planted on October 6 in 2013 and 2014, and harvested in early June. Summer maize was planted immediately after the wheat harvest. The cultivars used in this treatment were the same as for the Con.W-M treatment. The rate and timing of irrigation in the Opt.W-M and M-M systems were determined according to soil water content tests performed at the beginning of critical growing seasons. Nitrogen management for the Opt.W-M treatment followed the optimized management practices. Nitrogen input was 390 kg ha −1 yr −1, of which 205 kg ha −1 yr −1 was for winter wheat and 185 kg ha −1 yr −1 was for summer maize.
